intro: Ribes pachyadenium, commonly known as the thickened-stem currant, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which is part of the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its thick, woody stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in a fine pubescence. The fruit, which is a small, fleshy berry, is typically red or orange when mature and is edible.
